subSections.title: Etymology 1
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|わだち}}

Compound of {{compound|ja|sort=わだち|輪|tr1=wa|t1=wheel|立ち|tr2=tachi|t2=standing|pos2=the {{m|ja|連用形|tr=ren'yōkei||continuative or stem form}} of verb {{m|ja|立つ}} ''tatsu'', “to stand”, here in reference to the shape of the rut left standing after the passage of the wheel}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref> {{rendaku2|sort=わだち|tachi|dachi}}

subSections.title: Etymology 2
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|てつ}}

From {{der|ja|ltc|-}} {{ltc-l|轍|gloss=wagon rut, wheel track}}. The [[漢音#Japanese|kan'on]] reading, so likely a later borrowing. Compare modern {{cog|nan|-}} reading ''tia̍t''.

subSections.title: Noun
